title: Hire officers? Abolish the police? L.A.'s election reveals deep divisions over the LAPD
dc:creator: David Zahniser
description: Whoever wins the Nov. 8 city election could have a major say on police spending. They could also draw a tougher line on salary talks with the LAPD union.
content:encoded: Whoever wins the Nov. 8 city election could have a major say on police spending. They could also draw a tougher line on salary talks with the LAPD union.

media:content.media:description: L.A. City Council District 13 candidates Mitch O'Farrell, left, and Hugo Soto-Martinez.
